snippet: The Stevenson Companion Animal Life-Care Center at Texas A&M is one of a handful of retirement homes in the United States that provide for pets that outlive their owners.
abstract: Pet retirement homes, which will care for a pet upon the death of its owner, are few and far between in United States; Stevenson Companion Life-Care Center at Texas A&M University currently offers homes to 34 animals, with 510 committed future enrollments; enrollment fees and endowments are required, depending on age of owner at sign-up.
lead_paragraph: The Stevenson Companion Animal Life-Care Center at Texas A&M is one of a handful of retirement homes in the United States that provide for pets that outlive their owners.

headline.main: A Home for Pets When Their Owners Are Gone
